miss out.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to not have the chance to do something that you enjoy and that would be good for you
miss out.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Some children miss out because their parents can’t afford to pay for school trips.
Prepare food in advance to ensure you don’t miss out on the fun!
miss out.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to not include someone or something
miss out.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Make sure you don’t miss any details out.
miss out.translation[0].note_box[0].head: USAGE: Miss, fail to
miss out.translation[0].note_box[0].item: You use fail to when talking about not doing something that you should have done  Don't use miss in this meaning
Some students failed to pay attention in class
